reviews.review: very good game can u make a portal 3 ?
this game was 100% worth the purchase

I absolutely adore this game. I wasn't really allowed to play video games as a kid-early teen, so I was a bit late to the party on this one. Miraculously, I have avoided spoilers all of these years and so every twist in the game is super new and exciting to me. I love puzzles so this was really exciting to start playing. The gameplay was intuitive enough for a video game noob such as myself and I absolutely love everything about it. The puzzles, the little easter eggs here and there, the hilarious dialogue from the robots or recordings. The hidden rooms with graffiti. I have not yet completed the game, but 4 hours in and I am hooked. I do not regret this purchase one bit and it is $10 very well spent. I played around with the community workshops as well for a few minutes and I love that this is a feature. I can't wait to complete the singleplayer and go on to explore more of the tests created by the community.

I think in a way I prefer the first Portal's more simple and to the point approach, but Portal 2 is definetly an improvement on every single aspect. Funnier, longer and more interesting story, harder and a lot more comlex puzzles and an overall better experience. Oh, and don't forget the super fun coop mode. If you somehow missed Portal 2 definetly give it a try, it is still as unique as it was in 2011.

all memes aside, this game does not live up to portal 1.

in portal 1 when i got stuck i sweated it out till i work it out and i was happy to do so, the design was the tightest ive ever seen.

portal 2 has the problem that its been over developed, the first one was a very minimal design with no space wasted. this one has too much and especially in the later levels it has the issue of having to really look for a portal surface which took away from the momentum.

7/10 i finished it and its competent, its only crime is having an outstanding lineage.

A MUST play if you enjoy Valve games. Fun co-op and a brilliant story.

This was a really interesting game much similar to the first one. The story mode seemed to drone on for what felt like an eternity but the ending was well worth it. The puzzles were just as hard if not harder than Portal 1, and we finally get some closure at the end of the game. Will always recommend this game series! Cake is still a lie!

great level designs and good story

Even though this game is almost 10 years old, it still holds up very well. The gameplay is fun, the graphics looks nice because of the stylistic choices the developers made and the jokes are still as funny as when I heard them first when the game came out. An absolute classic. If you haven't played it yet, please do!

bonne suite de Portal, continue dans la voie des puzzles 3D avec une narration pleine d'humour. En plus la patte graphique est distincte et immersif, et le jeu tourne parfaitement sur mon PC vieillissant.

I like the puzzles and the concept of physics mixed with the idea of a teleportation device like the portal gun. Plus the humor is pretty funny. J.K. Simmons's voice plays a character in the game which is another plus.
